body_html:
I don't think this is tensorflow problem.

the files inside training-giga-fren.tar have been renamed:
After extracting you get this error:
IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: ...

ls into the folder of the data downloaded, in the default example it's /tmp/ and what you will see is this:

giga-fren.release2.fixed.en.gz  
giga-fren.release2.fixed.fr.gz  
training-giga-fren.tar 
...

Next, try doing this:

mv /tmp/giga-fren.release2.fixed.fr.gz /tmp/giga-fren.release2.fr.gz

mv /tmp/giga-fren.release2.fixed.en.gz /tmp/giga-fren.release2.en.gz

Which will recorrect name of the files into (giga-fren.release2.en or giga-fren.release2.fr) rather than the one with fixed.

re turn the python translate and bam it works now 😄

PS: if pull-requests are allowed, then I can fix this in the main file.

body:
I don't think this is tensorflow problem.

the files inside training-giga-fren.tar have been renamed:
After extracting you get this error:
`IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: ...`

ls into the folder of the data downloaded, in the default example it's `/tmp/` and what you will see is this:

```
giga-fren.release2.fixed.en.gz  
giga-fren.release2.fixed.fr.gz  
training-giga-fren.tar 
...
```

Next, try doing this:

`mv /tmp/giga-fren.release2.fixed.fr.gz /tmp/giga-fren.release2.fr.gz`

`mv /tmp/giga-fren.release2.fixed.en.gz /tmp/giga-fren.release2.en.gz`

Which will recorrect name of the files into (giga-fren.release2.en or giga-fren.release2.fr) rather than the one with fixed.

re turn the python translate and bam it works now 😄 

PS: if pull-requests are allowed, then I can fix this in the main file.
